citation.article-title: Nitriliruptor alkaliphilus gen. nov., sp. nov., a deep-lineage haloalkaliphilic actinobacterium from soda lakes capable of growth on aliphatic nitriles, and proposal of Nitriliruptoraceae fam. nov. and Nitriliruptorales ord. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Nitriliruptoraceae (Ni.tri.li.rup.to.ra′ceae. N.L. masc. n. Nitriliruptor type genus of the family; -aceae ending to denote a family; N.L. fem. pl. n. Nitriliruptoraceae the family of the genus Nitriliruptor).
Aerobic heterotrophs with the ability to degrade organic nitriles.
Members are alkaliphilic and moderately salt-tolerant.
A member of the order Nitriliruptorales in the class Actinobacteria.

The following pattern of 16S rRNA gene signature nucleotides and nucleotide pairs defines the family Nitriliruptoraceae: 47–396 (G–C), 232 (S), 241–285 (G–C), 291–309 (U–A), 294–303 (A–U), 295–302 (G–C), 361 (A), 443–491 (G–C), 890 (C), 1165–1171 (U–A), 1311–1326 (A–U).
